issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: ELB Instances page needs a refresh button to refresh instance health status

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I noticed that the health status/description does not automatically change when viewing the Instances tab from the ELB detail page.  It would be nice to have a refresh button in this tab rather than having to use the browser refresh button.
fields.summary: ELB Instances detail tab needs a refresh button.

comments.body: That's correct. We don't automatically refresh pages. The exception are in cases of transitional state. I could see adding smart-refresh if there are instances in a transitional state, but beyond that, it's by-design to help the app scale better.
wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Load+balancer+details updated to show refresh button on instance tab. use saem one that's on monitoring tab, plz

[~ashamblin], the location and alignment of the Refresh button does not match what [~jloza] requested in the Comments.

The mockup she referenced is attached as "ELB_details_Instances_tab_mockup.png."

A screen capture of the page she suggested we use as an example is attached as "ELB_details_Monitoring_tab.png."

A screen capture of the revised page you produced is attached as "ELB_details_Instances_tab."

Will you please:

1. Move the Refresh button up one line to the instruction line of text on the ELB details Instances tab

2. Right-align the Refresh button on that line.
Added styles for medium and small breakpoints.  Please test while resizing.

Verified on Macintosh running Chrome Version 45.0.2454.93 (64-bit), Firefox 40.0.3, and Safari 8.0.8.

Clever work, [~ashamblin].

UX review passed. Ready for code review.

Verified.  The refresh button is visible and appears to be working.

let's hide the refresh button for 4.2 and revisit when GUI-2130 is fixed in 4.2.1
